page.title: 05St.Peter's Church,Curdridge.
page.content: St. Peter's Church is in Curdridge, in the Diocese of Portsmouth. In 1835 a Chapel of Ease was built to save the parishioners travelling to Bishops Waltham for services. The porch can still be seen. The foundation stone of the present church was laid in 1887, and seven years later the tower was built in memory of Sir Charles Cory. It contains a ring of eight bells which are the fourth heaviest in the country, and unsurpassed in tone. There is no vicar at Curdridge at present, so the services are taken by the{Reader.}He takes family services, and special services at Harvest Festival, Christmas and Easter. He can conduct funerals, but he may not baptise or marry people. He visits the sick and sad in the parish. He does not get paid for his Church work.
